title: Quiz 4: Oct 2021 FQE
description: Final Qualifying Examination - October 2021. Comprehensive test covering database theory, Access objects, relationships, and data types.

questions.question: A collection of interrelated records is called a?
questions.explanation: A database is defined as a structured collection of data (interrelated records) stored and accessed electronically.
questions.hint: The main subject of this course.

questions.question: Microsoft Access is a ______
questions.explanation: Microsoft Access is a Relational Database Management System (RDBMS) that combines the relational Microsoft Jet Database Engine with a graphical user interface.

questions.question: Which one of the following is not an object of Ms-access?
questions.explanation: The standard objects in Microsoft Access are Tables, Queries, Forms, Reports, Macros, and Modules. A Row (or record) is a component of a Table, not a standalone database object.
questions.hint: This is part of a table, not a main object.

questions.question: Which option allows us to build a new table by entering data directly into a tabular grid?
questions.explanation: Datasheet View displays the table in a grid format (rows and columns) and allows you to enter data directly.
questions.hint: It looks like an Excel sheet.

questions.question: External database is _______
questions.explanation: A true database is created using a DBMS package. Excel is a spreadsheet and Word is a word processor.

questions.question: A primary key in any table has the properties _______
questions.explanation: A Primary Key must uniquely identify each record. Therefore, it cannot contain duplicate values (Unique) and it cannot be left empty (Not Null).
questions.hint: It must be unique and present.

questions.question: Report generators are used to _______

options.text: Store data input by a user

questions.explanation: Reports are used to present data in a formatted way. To do this, they must retrieve information from the database tables and often effectively answer queries by presenting the data.
questions.hint: They get data out to show you the answer.

questions.question: The logical data structure with a one-to-many relationship is a _______
questions.explanation: The Hierarchical model (often represented as a tree structure) is characterized by parent-child relationships (1:Many).

questions.question: In a database, related fields are grouped to _______
questions.explanation: A Record is a collection of related fields (e.g., Name, Age, Address) treated as a single unit.

questions.question: In one-to-many relationship the table in 'one' side is called ______ and on 'many' side is called ______
questions.explanation: The 'One' side is the Parent table, and the 'Many' side is the Child table.

questions.question: The database environment has all the following components except _______
questions.explanation: The database approach replaces traditional file-processing systems. Therefore, 'Separate files' (unintegrated data) is not a component of a database environment.
questions.hint: Databases integrate data, not keep it separate.

questions.question: Which one of the following is not a type of data type?
questions.explanation: Field Size is a property of a data type, not a data type itself.
questions.hint: This describes how big a field is, not what kind of data it holds.

questions.question: Which database handles full text data, image, audio and video?
questions.explanation: A Multimedia database is designed specifically to store, manage, and retrieve multimedia data such as text, images, audio, and video.

questions.question: What do you mean by one to many relationships between Teacher and Class table?

options.text: One class may have many students
One teacher can have many classes
Many classes may have many teachers
Many teachers may have many classes

questions.explanation: In a 'One-to-Many' relationship from Teacher to Class, a single Teacher record can be associated with multiple Class records.

questions.question: Define the term of input mask

options.text: It is a field property that controls the value of a record and sets in a specific format
It is an association among several entities
It's a collection of related fields that represent a single entity
It is a collection of related record

questions.explanation: An Input Mask is a property that controls how data is entered by providing a template (e.g., (___) ___-____ for phone numbers).
questions.hint: It masks the input to force a format.

questions.question: In one-to-many relationship the table on 'many' side is called
questions.explanation: The table on the 'Many' side of a relationship is referred to as the Child or Related table.

questions.question: In which state one gathers and lists all the necessary fields for the database design project.
questions.explanation: This phase involves defining the data requirements and listing fields, corresponding to Data Definition.

questions.question: Which of the following enables us to view data from a table based on a specific criterion?
questions.explanation: A Query is specifically designed to retrieve and view data based on specific criteria (filters).
questions.hint: It asks a question of the data.

questions.question: Which database object is ideal to view, change, and analyze data in different ways?
questions.explanation: Forms provide an interface specifically ideal to view, change, and enter data record by record.
questions.hint: The user-friendly interface for data entry.

questions.question: Which data type allows alphanumeric characters and special symbols to be entered?
questions.explanation: The Text (or Short Text) data type allows any combination of letters, numbers, and symbols.

questions.question: The size of Yes No field is always _______
questions.explanation: A Yes/No field requires only 1 bit of storage (0 or 1).

questions.question: It is used to establish an association between related tables.
questions.explanation: A Relationship is the association established between common fields in two tables.

questions.question: This key that uniquely identifies each record is called:
questions.explanation: The Primary Key is the unique identifier for each record in a database table.

questions.question: Which field type will you select if you need to enter long text in that field?
questions.explanation: The Memo data type (or Long Text) is used for storing large amounts of alphanumeric data.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a type of MS Access database object?
questions.explanation: Worksheets are Excel objects. Access objects include Tables, Queries, Forms, Reports, Macros, and Modules.

questions.question: In which method we don't need to specify the field type and size while creating a new Table?
questions.explanation: When creating a table by entering data (Datasheet View), Access infers the data types automatically.

questions.question: The size of yes/no field is always _______
questions.explanation: Duplicate question: 1 bit.

questions.question: The size of a field with number data type cannot be _______
questions.explanation: Standard Access numeric field sizes are 1, 2, 4, and 8 bytes. 16 is typically not a standard size.
questions.hint: Which is the odd one out?

questions.question: How can you edit a relationship already established between two tables?

options.text: Right click the relationship line and choose Edit Relationship

questions.explanation: Both methods (right-clicking and double-clicking the relationship line) open the Edit Relationships dialog.

questions.question: Which of the following option creates a Drop down List of values?
questions.explanation: The Lookup Wizard is used to create a field that allows the user to select a value from a drop-down list.

questions.question: What can be the maximum length of a text field?
questions.explanation: The maximum number of characters in a standard Text (Short Text) field in Access is 255.

questions.question: What Cascade Delete option is used for?

options.text: It is used to delete all the records of all tables in a database
It repeats the recent delete operation to all the records of current table
It ensures that all the related records will be deleted automatically when the record from parent table is deleted
It is used to delete all the records of related tables in a database

questions.explanation: Cascade Delete Related Records ensures referential integrity by automatically deleting any child records when the corresponding parent record is deleted.
questions.hint: Deleting a parent also deletes the children.

questions.question: While creating relationship using mouse, how the mouse pointer looks like?
questions.explanation: When dragging a field to create a relationship in Access, the pointer typically changes to show a small rectangle representing the field being dragged.
questions.hint: A small shape representing the field.

questions.question: The columns in a Microsoft access table are also called _______
questions.explanation: In Access terminology, columns are referred to as Fields.

questions.question: In the context of Microsoft Access, which of the following statement is true?

options.text: Reports are used to retrieve and calculate data from tables
Queries can be printed and presented as the information
Queries can include calculated fields that do not exist in table
Reports and forms are similar but forms are used to print but reports to display on screen only

questions.explanation: Queries allow you to create new fields using formulas (calculated fields) that are not stored in the underlying tables.
questions.hint: You can do math in a query.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a field type in Microsoft Access?
questions.explanation: Lookup Wizard is a tool, not a data type itself.
questions.hint: It's a wizard, not a type.

questions.question: While creating relationship, what happens when you release mouse pointer after you drop the primary key of a table into foreign key of another table?
questions.explanation: Access opens the Edit Relationships dialog box, allowing you to define the relationship type and enforce referential integrity.
questions.hint: A window pops up to confirm details.

questions.question: What is a form?

options.text: Forms are used only to view information
Forms can be previewed on the screen, but they are usually printed
Forms generally provide a detailed look at records and usually for the people who actually work with the database
Forms are often used to group and summarize data

questions.explanation: Forms are the primary interface for data entry and viewing, designed for users interacting directly with the database records.
questions.hint: The user interface for data entry.

questions.question: What is the size limitation for an access database?
questions.explanation: Older versions had a 1 GB limit. Modern versions have a 2 GB limit. 1 GB is the accepted answer in this context.
questions.hint: It's relatively small compared to enterprise databases.

questions.question: _______ enables the user to automatically insert numbers in a sequential or random number.
questions.explanation: The AutoNumber data type automatically generates a unique sequential number for each new record.
